## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hi there! I'm here to help you learn more about Verus. Do you have any questions about Verus or its features?

**User:**
Yeah, I was wondering about bridge converter currencies. What are they?

**AI Assistant:**
Bridge converter currencies are a type of fractional basket currency that is bound to the launch of a new blockchain. They have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies, but run on the new blockchain and generate fees that are earned on the new blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain. Does that make sense? Do you have any further questions about bridge converter currencies?

**User:**
That helps! But I'm still a bit confused about fractional basket currencies in general. Can you explain the concept of fractional basket currencies in Verus DeFi, and how they work?

**AI Assistant:**
In Verus DeFi, fractional basket currencies are a type of currency that is backed by one or more asset currencies at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100%. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing issues like miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running. Does that help clarify things?

**User:**
That's really interesting. How do simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches work in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
In Verus, simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches allow for the creation of a new blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies, but are bound to the launch of the new blockchain, running on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity. Does that make sense?

**User:**
That's really cool. What are Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies, exactly?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies are currencies backed by one or more asset currencies, with a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing the liquidity pool. These currencies are part of the Verus DeFi protocol, which ensures simultaneous pricing and solving of all currency conversions using a particular liquidity pool and mined into one block, addressing MEV and front-running issues. Do you have any more questions about Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies?

**User:**
How does the Verus DeFi protocol address miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi protocol addresses MEV and front-running by ensuring that all currency conversions using a particular liquidity pool and mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This prevents miners from extracting value by reordering transactions or front-running, providing a fair and secure DeFi experience. Do you have any more questions about MEV and front-running?

**User:**
How do blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches work on Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
On Verus, blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches allow users to set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in their preferred currencies on-chain. If the minimums are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of all their pre-conversions, less network fees. Launch options also provide for maximum participation, pre-launch discounts, price-neutral pre-allocations, and vesting schedules using VerusIDs. Do you have any more questions about crowdfunding currency launches on Verus?

**User:**
What is the Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network is a network that allows the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains. Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, enabling public blockchains available for merge mining and staking, as well as private, internal blockchains that are easy to set up with easy bridging of public currencies. Do you have any more questions about the Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network?

**User:**
Finally, what is the significance of simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
In Verus, simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches allow for the creation of a new blockchain and a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool at the same time. This enables the new blockchain to have its own liquidity pool, with fees generated from cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool earned on the new blockchain, without any rent going back to the Verus blockchain.

What are bridge converter currencies?

Bridge converter currencies are a type of fractional basket currency that is bound to the launch of a new blockchain. They have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies, but run on the new blockchain and generate fees that are earned on the new blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain.

ne Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity. ## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge) - Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and pre-launch discounts for early participants.
